gcci.text: At $3.20/hour for H100 access, current market pricing reflects normalized supply chains post-2024 shortages, though persistent allocation constraints continue to drive capex inflation for hyperscalers seeking guaranteed compute capacity.

gtpi.text: API pricing at $1.25/1M input tokens signals aggressive commoditization pressure, forcing model providers to optimize inference efficiency and potentially triggering consolidation among smaller players unable to sustain razor-thin margins.

gagl.text: Annual load of 120 TWh represents a critical inflection point where AI infrastructure demand alone could necessitate accelerated nuclear deployment and grid modernization investments to maintain reliability thresholds.

aipi.text: Converging cost pressures across compute, energy, and API services suggest the AI boom is transitioning from unsustainable exponential growth to a normalization phase where operational efficiency becomes the primary competitive differentiator.
